content.body: nessy: we shall see! I think things will be fine
I look forward to the further discussion!
TabAtkins, all right, I'm halfway through the new parser.
Woo, first pass of new table-layout algorithm, custom-designed for Template Layout. www.xanthir.com/:tm7
JonathanNeal: btw it's spelt conceal, not conseal :-)
Shame on me.
JonathanNeal: did you post yet?
I posted the first version @ http://www.iecss.com/print-protector/
cool
now i can tweet it
but the next version uses an idea TabAtkins pitched where I parse through the stylesheets and generate a secondary HTML5 css file that works with classnames.
Wellllll I dunno if we wanna tweet it yet, do we?
JonathanNeal: Since you've mentioned it on IRC, surely it'll spread onto and around the Twitsphere by itself, so it's too late to try to stop it now
Yeap.
Can't I make your glass half full ever, Philip`? :)
I don't expect you can fill that precisely - it'll always be slightly more or slightly less than half full
:) JonathanNeal i think its a good time to start leaking out
Yea go for it!
I finished the new version.
http://www.iecss.com/print-protector/example_print_iepp_1-2-0.html
will try to print it when he gets home.
TabAtkins, you can see the new code @ http://www.iecss.com/print-protector/javascript/iepp.1-2-0.js
JonathanNeal: nice work on iepp!
“is piece of javascript” → “is a piece of javascript”
Good catch, updated.
boblet, you have a copy of ie?
yes, but in a VM that is broken :/
so I guess that’s kinda no huh
fails at replying
Hixie: http://www.w3.org/Bugs/Public/show_bug.cgi?id=9472 (deal with broken links in dynamic author view of spec by prompting users to choose to switch to full view)
from discussion last monday
I didn't manage to get around to raising it til now
btw, I notice something else while looking at a validator.nu bug about option/@type=selected descendants of select/@multiple elements
http://bugzilla.validator.nu/show_bug.cgi?id=734
er, not type=selected of course, but just selected
anyway, I can't find anywhere in the spec that states the conformance constraint that an option/@selected can only occur as a descendant of select/@multiple

in contrast, the section on the file-upload state for the input element has a paragraph explicitly marked with a "Constraint validation" subhead that says, "Unless the multiple attribute is set, there must be no more than one file in the list of selected files"
http://dev.w3.org/html5/spec/forms.html#file-upload-state
er, I guess the "Constraint validation" part is not relevant here, but the paragraph I cited that follows it is
http://www.w3.org/Bugs/Public/show_bug.cgi?id=9473
Okay! http://www.iecss.com/print-protector/ --- updated!  Happy weekend, everyone!
waves
gsnedders: hey
MikeSmith: I bought The Third Policeman, BTW
are you waving goodbye, hello, or waving for help?
gsnedders: ah, great book
waving hello
well, I envy you for being able to read The Third Policeman for the first time
is going to end up writing a terrible blog post that he'll scrap, again...
rambles on endlessly
publish it under an assumed name
That won't help. It's still nonsense.
e.g. Geoffrey Snedders O'Brien
that'll throw people off
still wants to finally start the art project he's had in his mind for a while
But everytime I think about it, I think of another way I have to conseal my identity
Like, to properly have an anon blog is a load of work
gsnedders: here's another idea - just start a "The Fake Geoffrey Snedders Blog" and write stuff that would fit the stereotype that others might have of your private thoughts
people would read it and chuckle about it and say, Man, whoever this guy is, he's got Geoffrey pegged
:P
So, basically, act emo?
act like you're somebody who's not emo but who's trying to act emo
Man, that's a lot of acting
well, it's only acting like you're not yourself but actually just being yourself
a celebration of yourself
But that wouldn't be matching the stereotype
well, that's why it's the Fake Geoffrey Snedders Blog
it's a chance for you to explore another side of yourself
the self-parody side
The wreckless, fearless, uncompromising one?
The Third Policeman will give you some inspiration
gsnedders: the laughing-through-the-tears side
Like I don't do that already.
I mean, all the world's a stage.
yep
and you are the star
the tragic hero
tragic comedy
celebrate yourself in the manner of Walt Whitman
except with humor like Flann O'Brien
heyo, hey MikeSmith :)
JonathanNeal: word up
Someday I'll just have to scream out in here that I'm married.
And that I'll start being euphoric all the time
And get rid of this entire persona people have of me.
gsnedders, you okay?
JonathanNeal: Yeah, this is what happens when you enter mid-conversation
I mean, if I posted that on the Fake gsnedders Blog it'd blatantly be fake.
are there any plans to reserve a port for websockets? or is it up to the developer to choose?
or only on the usual http/https ports?
nm, it's in the ietf draft ;>
http://google-opensource.blogspot.com/2010/04/interesting-times-for-video-on-web.html
Summary for lazy people: Google is helping fund an ARM code optimised version of the Theora video codec
ah great, saves me some reading
:p
Good morning.
What doctype(s) must I use for a page including <video> to validate?
<!doctype html>
What'll happen to old or ancient browsers that see the html5 doctype?
nothing
mikelifeguard: http://www.w3.org/TR/html5-diff/#doctype
good morning everyone
Good morning.
